name: TheAtlantic
text: “There’s almost no importance in talking about record-breaking events anymore, when talking about fires in California,” a climate scientist tells @yayitsrob, “because we’ve broken all the records so many times that … what do they even mean anymore?” https://t.co/7zHzW15HAV

name: TheAtlantic
text: Because of the Electoral College, "Biden has no incentive to run up his margin in three reliably blue states" @PeterBeinart writes. "Instead, he’s singularly focused on purple ones in the Midwest." https://t.co/E7n466dXtx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Just as today we say the names of the many who have been unjustly killed by police officers, the names of those four girls became part of the call for change that energized social protests in the 1960s," Freeman A. Hrabowski III writes: https://t.co/AX7d0w4Y86

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the past four years, Britain has struggled against the heft of the EU as it seeks a new relationship with the bloc. The upshot is that London is now staring at a diplomatic defeat that would have seemed almost unimaginable before, writes @tommctague. https://t.co/v3nMtWMz4H

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bunkers let you believe what you want to believe, and comfort yourself against the horrors of that belief, alone and underground, @AnnieLowrey reports. Business is booming. https://t.co/7aCJLClEAh

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This president is different; the rules are different; and if it doesn’t adapt, fast, the press will stand as yet another institution that failed in a moment of crucial pressure," @JamesFallows writes: https://t.co/LMj5Vfeuaq

name: TheAtlantic
text: Only a few days left until #TheAtlanticFest 2020, featuring guests like Bill Gates, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, and many more. Join us for an exploration of what the United States has faced, and what we will become: https://t.co/Ri8NkZCjiA https://t.co/1z9NCYBkGr

name: TheAtlantic
text: Every day, @megangarber writes, the most watched shows of the country’s most watched news network take the idioms of American democracy and wear away at their common meanings. https://t.co/MteXW4KA5L

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sufjan Stevens was once known for mythologizing America. Now he’s dreaming about breaking up the country. The singer tells @skornhaber about his “political and bossy and bitchy” new album, “The Ascension.” https://t.co/StwDJskb8B

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Oddly, the White House has expressed practically no interest in supercharging the economic engine that could drive the president to victory," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/1o5MVnjfwG

name: TheAtlantic
text: The western wildfires reach national political salience. What took so long? Then: Is it just you or is everything sold out? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/uTczyMJxST
